TableContextTimeStampAfterTable: {185955=Copyright © 2014 Apple Inc. All rights reserved., 77117=Channeling Bruce Springsteen’s epic greatness into any single collection, no matter how extensive, yields just a snapshot of the man’s gifts. This set features both the obvious (“Thunder Road,” “Born to Run,” “Hungry Heart,” “Dancing in the Dark”) and the lesser-known (“Land of Hope and Dreams,” “Living Proof”). There are also songs that never made it to an official Springsteen album, like “From Small Things (Big Things One Day Come)” (a hit for Dave Edmunds), Jimmy Cliff’s “Trapped” (which appeared on a benefit album in the ‘80s), the Nebraska-era b-side “The Big Payback,” and “Viva Las Vegas”. Although what makes Springsteen essential is captured on his studio albums, it’s hard to argue with any collection that sports “Spirit in the Night,” “4th of July, Asbury Park (Sandy),” “Jungleland,” “Darkness on the Edge of Town,” “The River,” “Brilliant Disguise,” and “The Ghost of Tom Joad.” Songs spanning from his earliest days to this album’s 2003 release make this a decent look at Bruce’s career. However, one should be warned. His magic is addictive., 82184=Born: September 23, 1949 in Freehold, NJ}

textAfterTable: 42 Songs Editors’ Notes Channeling Bruce Springsteen’s epic greatness into any single collection, no matter how extensive, yields just a snapshot of the man’s gifts. This set features both the obvious (“Thunder Road,” “Born to Run,” “Hungry Heart,” “Dancing in the Dark”) and the lesser-known (“Land of Hope and Dreams,” “Living Proof”). There are also songs that never made it to an official Springsteen album, like “From Small Things (Big Things One Day Come)” (a hit for Dave Edmunds), Jimmy Cliff’s “Trapped” (which appeared on a benefit album in the ‘80s), the Nebraska-era b-side “The Big Payback,” and “Viva Las Vegas”. Although what makes Springsteen essential is captured on his studio albums, it’s hard to argue with any collection that sports “Spirit in the Night,” “4th of July, Asbury Park (Sandy),” “Jungleland,” “Darkness on the Edge of Town,” “The River,” “Brilliant Disguise,” and “The Ghost of Tom Joad.” Songs spanning from his earliest days to this album’s 2003 release make this a decent look at Bruce’s career. However, one should be warned. His magic is addictive. Customer Reviews Missing Songs           by What It Is
